citation.article-title: Tropicibacter naphthalenivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon-degrading bacterium isolated from Semarang Port in Indonesia.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Tropicibacter [Trop.ic.i.bac.ter. L. adj. tropicus tropical, pertaining to the tropical zone of the Earth; N.L. masc. n. bacter (from Gr. n. bakterion) rod; N.L. masc. n. Tropicibacter a rod belonging to the tropical zone].
Cells are Gram-negative, motile by means of peritrichous flagella and rod-shaped (1.1–3.4 μm long and 0.1–0.7 μm wide).
Positive for oxidase and nitrate reduction.
The predominant fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0 and 11 methyl C18 : 1ω7c.
The type species is Tropicibacter naphthalenivorans.
